member.name: T:Jboy.JsonException
member.summary: Signals that something went wrong while reading or writing JSON data.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonException.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new JsonException instance.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new JsonException instance.
member.param: The message to present to the user.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Creates a new JsonException instance.
member.param: The message to present to the user.
An inner exception that is contained in this JsonException instance.

member.name: T:Jboy.JsonReader
member.summary: Represents a stream of JSON text that the user can read from. Reading is performed using the class methods.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new JsonReader instance, containing the given text input. This can be used to read and parse the contents of the input.
member.param: A string containing the JSON text to parse.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to calling new JsonReader(jsonText, true, true).

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new JsonReader instance, containing the given text input. This can be used to read and parse the contents of the input. This also allows setting whether the input should allow comments and single-quoted strings.
member.param: A string containing the JSON text to parse.
Sets whether the parser should allow the input to contain comments.
Sets whether the parser should allow the input to contain single-quoted strings.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.Close
member.summary: Closes the JsonReader and releases underlying system resources.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.ReadString
member.summary: Reads a JSON string value from the stream.
member.returns: The string value that was read.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if no string value could be read at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.ReadNumber
member.summary: Reads a JSON number value from the stream.
member.returns: The number value that was read.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if no number value could be read at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.ReadBoolean
member.summary: Reads a JSON boolean value from the stream.
member.returns: The boolean value that was read.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if no boolean value could be read at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.ReadPropertyName
member.summary: Reads a property name of a JSON object from the stream.
member.returns: The property name that was read.
member.remarks:
Throws a JsonException if no property name could be read at the current position.
Note the difference between and . The first one reads any property name and returns it through the out parameter. The second one tries to read a secific property name and will fail if it does not find it. Use the latter of the two as an assertion that the next property of the stream matches what you expect.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.ReadPropertyName(System.String)
member.summary: Reads a given property name of a JSON object from the stream.
member.param: The expected property name to read.
member.remarks:
Throws a JsonException if no property name that matches the expected name could be read at the current position.
Note the difference between and . The first one reads any property name and returns it through the out parameter. The second one tries to read a secific property name and will fail if it does not find it. Use the latter of the two as an assertion that the next property of the stream matches what you expect.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.ReadArrayStart
member.summary: Reads the start of a JSON array from the stream. Use this as an assertion that an array begins at the current position.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if no array start could be read at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.ReadArrayEnd
member.summary: Reads the end of a JSON array from the stream. Use this as an assertion that an array ends at the current position.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if no array end could be read at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.ReadObjectStart
member.summary: Reads the start of a JSON object from the stream. Use this as an assertion that an object begins at the current position.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if no object start could be read at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.ReadObjectEnd
member.summary: Reads the end of a JSON object from the stream. Use this as an assertion that an object ends at the current position.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if no object end could be read at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.ReadNull
member.summary: Reads a JSON null value from the stream. Use this as an assertion that there is a null value at the current position.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if no null value could be read at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.TryReadString(System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to read a JSON string value from the stream.
member.param: The string value that was read.
member.returns: True if the read succeded, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.TryReadNumber(System.Double@)
member.summary: Tries to read a JSON number value from the stream.
member.param: The number value that was read.
member.returns: True if the read succeded, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.TryReadBoolean(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Tries to read a JSON boolean value from the stream.
member.param: The boolean value that was read.
member.returns: True if the read succeded, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.TryReadPropertyName(System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to read a property name of a JSON object from the stream.
member.param: The property name that was read.
member.returns: True if the read succeded, or false otherwise.
member.remarks: Note the difference between and . The first one reads any property name and returns it through the out parameter. The second one tries to read a secific property name and will fail if it does not find it. Use the latter of the two as an assertion that the next property of the stream matches what you expect.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.TryReadPropertyName(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to read a given property name of a JSON object from the stream.
member.param: The expected property name to read.
member.returns: True if the read succeded, or false otherwise.
member.remarks: Note the difference between and . The first one reads any property name and returns it through the out parameter. The second one tries to read a secific property name and will fail if it does not find it. Use the latter of the two as an assertion that the next property of the stream matches what you expect.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.TryReadObjectStart
member.summary: Tries to read the start of a JSON object from the stream.
member.returns: True if the read succeded, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.TryReadObjectEnd
member.summary: Tries to read the end of a JSON object from the stream.
member.returns: True if the read succeded, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.TryReadArrayStart
member.summary: Tries to read the start of a JSON array from the stream.
member.returns: True if the read succeded, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.TryReadArrayEnd
member.summary: Tries to read the end of a JSON array from the stream.
member.returns: True if the read succeded, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.TryReadNull
member.summary: Tries to read a JSON null value from the stream.
member.returns: True if the read succeded, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonReader.Read(System.Object@)
member.summary: Reads the next token from the stream. Also returns the associated value if one can be produced.
member.param: The associated parsed value of the next token.
member.returns: The next token in the stream.
member.remarks: This method will succeed regardless of the state of the stream. If there is a valid token at the current position in the stream, that token will be returned and the parameter will contain its parsed value if applicable. If at the end of the stream, the return value will be .

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonReader.EndOfInput
member.summary: Signals whether the reader has reached the end of the input stream.

member.name: T:Jboy.JsonToken
member.summary: Represents a token in the JSON text stream.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.None
member.summary: Represents no token at all.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.ObjectStart
member.summary: Represents the start of a JSON object.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.PropertyName
member.summary: Represents a property name within a JSON object.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.ObjectEnd
member.summary: Represents the end of a JSON object.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.ArrayStart
member.summary: Represents the start of a JSON array.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.ArrayEnd
member.summary: Represents the end of a JSON array.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.String
member.summary: Represents a JSON string value.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.Number
member.summary: Represents a JSON number value.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.Boolean
member.summary: Represents a JSON boolean value.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.Null
member.summary: Represents a JSON null value.

member.name: F:Jboy.JsonToken.End
member.summary: Represents the end of the input JSON stream.

member.name: T:Jboy.JsonWriter
member.summary: Represents a stream of JSON text that the user can write to. Writing is performed using the class methods.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new empty JsonWriter instance that can be used to write JSON data to text.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to calling new JsonWriter(true, false, 4).

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a new empty JsonWriter instance that can be used to write JSON data to text. Also allows you to specify options for validation, pretty-printing and indentation.
member.param: Sets whether the JsonWriter should validate that the output produced is correct JSON.
Sets whether the JsonWriter should insert whitespace (indentation and linebreaks) to make the output more readable.
Sets the number of spaces one indentation level should be. If is false, this value has no effect.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.ToString
member.summary: Converts the JsonWriter contents to a string. This lets you extract the produced JSON text and use it in string from.
member.returns: A string containing the produced JSON text.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.Reset
member.summary: Clears the contents of the JsonWriter and resets it to its initial state.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.WriteString(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a JSON string value to the stream.
member.param: The string value to write.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if the value could not be written at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.WriteNumber(System.Double)
member.summary: Writes a JSON number value to the stream.
member.param: The number value to write.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if the value could not be written at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.WriteBoolean(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a JSON boolean value to the stream.
member.param: The boolean value to write.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if the value could not be written at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.WritePropertyName(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a JSON object property name to the stream.
member.param: The property name to write.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if the property name could not be written at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.WriteObjectStart
member.summary: Writes the start of a JSON object to the stream.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if the object start could not be written at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.WriteObjectEnd
member.summary: Writes the end of a JSON object to the stream.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if the object end could not be written at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.WriteArrayStart
member.summary: Writes the start of a JSON array to the stream.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if the array start could not be written at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.WriteArrayEnd
member.summary: Writes the end of a JSON array to the stream.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if the array end could not be written at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.WriteNull
member.summary: Writes a JSON null value to the stream.
member.remarks: Throws a JsonException if the value could not be written at the current position.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.TryWriteString(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to write a JSON string value to the stream.
member.param: The string value to write.
member.returns: True if the write was successful, and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.TryWriteNumber(System.Double)
member.summary: Tries to write a JSON number value to the stream.
member.param: The number value to write.
member.returns: True if the write was successful, and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.TryWriteBoolean(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tries to write a JSON boolean value to the stream.
member.param: The boolean value to write.
member.returns: True if the write was successful, and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.TryWritePropertyName(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to write a JSON object property name to the stream.
member.param: The property name to write.
member.returns: True if the write was successful, and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.TryWriteObjectStart
member.summary: Tries to write the start of a JSON object to the stream.
member.returns: True if the write was successful, and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.TryWriteObjectEnd
member.summary: Tries to write the end of a JSON object to the stream.
member.returns: True if the write was successful, and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.TryWriteArrayStart
member.summary: Tries to write the start of a JSON array to the stream.
member.returns: True if the write was successful, and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.TryWriteArrayEnd
member.summary: Tries to write the end of a JSON array to the stream.
member.returns: True if the write was successful, and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonWriter.TryWriteNull
member.summary: Tries to write a JSON null value to the stream.
member.returns: True if the write was successful, and false otherwise.

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonWriter.CurrentDepth
member.summary: Returns the depth level of the current write position in the JSON tree. Depth 0 represents the root level and each level above represents one more nested JSON array or JSON object.
